title: Risk & Governance
learning_objectives: Identify key risks in enterprise LIMS/ELN projects.
Communicate governance and validation frameworks clearly.
Demonstrate Scifeon’s ability to reduce risk through structure.
content:
Enterprise buyers evaluate risk as seriously as functionality. A strong proposal describes how Scifeon manages risk across implementation, validation, and operation. Governance structures—steering committees, escalation paths, documented responsibilities—signal maturity and control. Include them proactively, not reactively.

When presenting validation, reference recognized frameworks such as GAMP 5 or 21 CFR Part 11. Show exactly how Scifeon’s process produces traceable, auditable results. This reassures QA and Procurement that adopting Scifeon will not expose them to compliance uncertainty.

exercises.instruction: Draft a short governance paragraph describing steering committee composition and meeting rhythm.
List three project risks and one mitigation action for each.

quiz.question: What does 'Governance' communicate to an enterprise buyer?
options: Who manages the project and how decisions are made
quiz.answer: Who manages the project and how decisions are made

quiz.question: Why reference GAMP 5 or 21 CFR Part 11?
options: To prove compliance alignment and audit readiness
quiz.answer: To prove compliance alignment and audit readiness
